original_definition: 'non-woody biomass' means biomass other than woody biomass, including, inter alia, straw, miscanthus, reeds, kernels, grains, olive stones, olive cakes and nut shells;
generated_definition: 'non-woody biomass' means other fuels or blends of biomass and fossil fuel, sufficient for unambiguous identification and technical specifications, including measured moisture and ash content for biomass and volatile content for fossil fuel.

Article 9: where thepreferred fuelor anyother suitable fuelis otherwoody biomass,non-woody biomass, other fossil fuel or other blend of biomass and fossil fuel as referred to in Table 1, a description of the fuel sufficient for its unambiguous identification and the technical standard or specification of the fuel, including the measured moisture content and the measured ash content, and for other fossil fuel also the measured volatile content of the fuel.

where the preferred fuel or any other suitable fuel is other woody biomass, non-woody biomass, other fossil fuel or other blend of biomass and fossil fuel as referred to in Table 1, a description of the fuel sufficient for its unambiguous identification and the technical standard or specification of the fuel, including the measured moisture content and the measured ash content, and for other fossil fuel also the measured volatile content of the fuel.
